intro: Psacalium peltatum var. adenophorum, commonly known as the腺花木, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, tropical environments. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in warm climates.
